private_information: I have a local view of the first scenario block with objects up to object_12 and the initial facts listed in the first STATEMENT.
I observe the first plan sequence provided after that STATEMENT and can validate preconditions and effects locally for my observed actions.
planner_alpha.goal: Produce a clear, structured partial action specification and local state transition model for the first scenario that can be consumed by an integrator.

private_information: I have a local view of the second scenario block with objects up to object_13 and the initial facts listed in the second STATEMENT.
I observe the second plan and can validate preconditions and effects locally for my observed actions.
planner_beta.goal: Produce a clear, structured partial action specification and local state transition model for the second scenario that can be consumed by an integrator.

private_information: I monitor temporal and causal consistency across planners and detect bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, and ad-hoc state fixes.
I am charged with producing corrected state modelling recommendations and a short list of removed or relabeled bookkeeping shortcuts.
auditor.goal: Audit the partial specifications from planners, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, propose minimal consistent corrections, and produce an audit report that enables sound multi-agent integration.

private_information: I receive the partial specifications and the auditor report and must integrate them into a single coherent planning domain and problem tailored for FastDownwards.
I must keep agent actions distinct and document which agent is responsible for which actions.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the partial specs and audit corrections and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: There is a set of objects named object_0 through object_13.
Available atomic predicates include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, collect and other relation atoms used by the actions.

Available actions are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted. Each action is parameterized over object tokens and has specified preconditions and effects in the private specification fragments.
Two scenario statements were provided with initial facts and goals. Each scenario includes an initial facts block, a goal block of next predicates, and an intended plan sequence.
Planners have partial, local views and may use different object names or bookkeeping shortcuts. The orchestrator must reconcile naming and remove bookkeeping shortcuts identified by the auditor.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst agent. Produce a machine readable partial action specification and local state transition model derived from your local scenario observation. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on listing the actions you can validate, each action signature, concrete preconditions you can confirm, concrete effects you can confirm, and any ambiguous or missing facts that would block integration.
analyze.prompt: Your name is planner_alpha. You have access to the public environment information {environment->public_information}. You also have the following private observational facts: {agents->planner_alpha->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->planner_alpha->goal}. Examine the first STATEMENT and the associated plan fragment you observed. Produce a structured partial specification describing: action names seen, for each action the parameters as observed, required preconditions you can confirm, effects you can confirm, and any ambiguities or missing links. Return the output labelled as spec_planner_alpha.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst agent. Produce a machine readable partial action specification and local state transition model derived from your local scenario observation. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on listing the actions you can validate, each action signature, concrete preconditions you can confirm, concrete effects you can confirm, and any ambiguous or missing facts that would block integration.
analyze.prompt: Your name is planner_beta. You have access to the public environment information {environment->public_information}. You also have the following private observational facts: {agents->planner_beta->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->planner_beta->goal}. Examine the second STATEMENT and the associated plan fragment you observed. Produce a structured partial specification describing: action names seen, for each action the parameters as observed, required preconditions you can confirm, effects you can confirm, and any ambiguities or missing links. Return the output labelled as spec_planner_beta.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specialized in temporal and causal consistency. Your role is to detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts and to produce minimal corrective transformations to make the combined specifications sound. Produce a clear audit report with items classified as 'removed_bookkeeping', 'renamings', 'uncertain_preconditions', and 'recommended_corrections'. Do not generate PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You receive the partial specifications {spec_planner_alpha} and {spec_planner_beta}. Your goal is {agents->auditor->goal}. Inspect both specs for causal cycles, hidden quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, ad-hoc state resets, or other shortcuts. Produce an audit_report describing each issue, propose renamings to unify referents, propose which bookkeeping items to remove or refactor, and provide corrected local facts that should be presented to the orchestrator for integration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL problems and must produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file intended for the FastDownwards planner. Keep agent actions distinct and document agent responsibility. Emit a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem tailored to FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Do not include escape sequences inside string literals.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You have the public information {environment->public_information}, the partial specifications {spec_planner_alpha} and {spec_planner_beta}, and the audit corrections {audit_report}. Your goal is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the partial specifications while applying the auditor corrections. Resolve renamings, remove bookkeeping shortcuts as recommended, make all preconditions and effects explicit, and ensure temporal and causal consistency. Produce a PDDL domain and problem that FastDownwards can consume. Keep actions attributed to their originating agent by prefixing action names with the agent name. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Return the output labelled pddl_orchestrator.
